metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21704 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.29, 7.4.x below 7.4.21 and 8.0.x below 8.0.8, when using Firebird PDO driver extension, a malicious database server could cause crashes in various database functions, such as getAttribute(), execute(), fetch() and others by returning invalid response data that is not parsed correctly by the driver. This can result in crashes, denial of service or potentially memory corruption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5
php7.4-cgi - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.5').
